verses.verse: The burden <S%H4853><s%> of Nineveh. <S%H5210><s%> The book <S%H5612><s%> of the vision <S%H2377><s%> of Nahum <S%H5151><s%> the Elkoshite. <S%H512><s%>

God <S%H410><s%> is jealous, <S%H7072><s%> and the LORD <S%H3068><s%> revenges; <S%H5358><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> revenges, <S%H5358><s%> and is furious; <S%H1167><s%> <S%H2534><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> will take vengeance <S%H5358><s%> on his adversaries, <S%H6862><s%> and he reserves <S%H5201><s%> wrath for his enemies. <S%H341><s%>

The LORD <S%H3068><s%> is slow <S%H750><s%> to anger, <S%H639><s%> and great <S%H1431><s%> in power, <S%H3581><s%> and will not at all acquit <S%H5352><s%> the wicked: the LORD <S%H3068><s%> has his way <S%H1870><s%> in the whirlwind <S%H5492><s%> and in the storm, <S%H8183><s%> and the clouds <S%H6051><s%> are the dust <S%H80><s%> of his feet. <S%H7272><s%>

He rebukes <S%H1605><s%> the sea, <S%H3220><s%> and makes it dry, <S%H3001><s%> and dries <S%H2717><s%> up all <S%H3605><s%> the rivers: <S%H5104><s%> Bashan <S%H1316><s%> languishes, <S%H535><s%> and Carmel, <S%H3760><s%> and the flower <S%H6525><s%> of Lebanon <S%H3844><s%> languishes. <S%H535><s%>

The mountains <S%H2022><s%> quake <S%H7493><s%> at him, and the hills <S%H1389><s%> melt, <S%H4127><s%> and the earth <S%H776><s%> is burned <S%H5375><s%> at his presence, <S%H6440><s%> yes, the world, <S%H8398><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> that dwell <S%H3427><s%> therein.

Who <S%H4310><s%> can stand <S%H5975><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> his indignation? <S%H2195><s%> and who <S%H4310><s%> can abide <S%H6965><s%> in the fierceness <S%H2740><s%> of his anger? <S%H639><s%> his fury <S%H2534><s%> is poured <S%H5413><s%> out like fire, <S%H784><s%> and the rocks <S%H6697><s%> are thrown <S%H5422><s%> down <S%H5422><s%> by him.

The LORD <S%H3068><s%> is good, <S%H2896><s%> a strong <S%H4581><s%> hold <S%H4581><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> of trouble; <S%H6869><s%> and he knows <S%H3045><s%> them that trust <S%H2620><s%> in him.

But with an overrunning <S%H5674><s%> flood <S%H7858><s%> he will make <S%H6213><s%> an utter <S%H3617><s%> end <S%H3615><s%> of the place <S%H4725><s%> thereof, and darkness <S%H2822><s%> shall pursue <S%H7291><s%> his enemies. <S%H341><s%>

What <S%H4100><s%> do you imagine <S%H2803><s%> against <S%H413><s%> the LORD? <S%H3068><s%> he will make <S%H6213><s%> an utter <S%H3617><s%> end: <S%H3615><s%> affliction <S%H6869><s%> shall not rise <S%H6965><s%> up the second time. <S%H6471><s%>

For while <S%H5704><s%> they be entwined <S%H5440><s%> together as thorns, <S%H5518><s%> and while they are drunken <S%H5435><s%> as drunkards, <S%H5435><s%> they shall be devoured <S%H398><s%> as stubble <S%H7179><s%> fully <S%H4390><s%> dry. <S%H3002><s%>
There is one come <S%H3318><s%> out of you, that imagines <S%H2803><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> a wicked <S%H1100><s%> counselor. <S%H3289><s%>

Thus <S%H3541><s%> said <S%H559><s%> the LORD; <S%H3068><s%> Though <S%H518><s%> they be quiet, <S%H8003><s%> and likewise <S%H3651><s%> many, <S%H7227><s%> yet thus <S%H3651><s%> shall they be cut <S%H1494><s%> down, when he shall pass <S%H5674><s%> through. Though I have afflicted <S%H6031><s%> you, I will afflict <S%H6031><s%> you no <S%H3808><s%> more. <S%H5750><s%>
For now <S%H6258><s%> will I break <S%H7665><s%> his yoke <S%H4132><s%> from off <S%H5921><s%> you, and will burst <S%H5423><s%> your bonds <S%H4147><s%> in sunder.

And the LORD <S%H3068><s%> has given a commandment <S%H6680><s%> concerning <S%H5921><s%> you, that no <S%H3808><s%> more <S%H5750><s%> of your name <S%H8034><s%> be sown: <S%H2232><s%> out of the house <S%H1004><s%> of your gods <S%H430><s%> will I cut <S%H3772><s%> off the graven <S%H6459><s%> image <S%H6755><s%> and the molten <S%H4541><s%> image: <S%H6755><s%> I will make <S%H7760><s%> your grave; <S%H6913><s%> for you are vile. <S%H7043><s%>

Behold <S%H2009><s%> on the mountains <S%H2022><s%> the feet <S%H7272><s%> of him that brings <S%H1319><s%> good <S%H1319><s%> tidings, <S%H1319><s%> that publishes <S%H8085><s%> peace! <S%H7965><s%> O Judah, <S%H3063><s%> keep <S%H2287><s%> your solemn <S%H2282><s%> feasts, <S%H2282><s%> perform <S%H7999><s%> your vows: <S%H5088><s%> for the wicked <S%H1100><s%> shall no <S%H3808><s%> more <S%H3254><s%> <S%H5750><s%> pass <S%H5674><s%> through you; he is utterly <S%H3605><s%> cut <S%H3772><s%> off.
